name: 911 Memorial Ground Zero Site Walking Tour  (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Explore New York’s 9/11 Memorial with an Experienced Licensed NYC Tour Guide. This way you won’t miss out on details and personal stories of the 2001 attacks. On My Tour, you will not only experience the 911 Memorial Pools and everything else in the area that is respect to what is also called Ground Zero, the 911 Memorial, and its Museum. You will explore all the area has to offer that can be fit into this tour by means of and during a walking tour with me your experienced NYC Licensed Tour Guide.

This free walking tour provides you with more: enabling you to experience the Memorial Pools and other key sights such as the Firefighters Memorial with a professional licensed NYC guide for added insight.
 
🎫 The cost of one 911 Memorial Museum Ticket is $26. The cost general admission to One World Observatory is $43. Tickets for both can be bought same day during tour.
 
🔴***Important I will not be giving tours inside of One World Trade Observatory and the 911 Memorial Museum. Only tour guides who work inside of the One World Trade Building and the 911 Memorial Museum specifically can give tours inside of those buildings, but they are not required to be NYC Licensed. Professional Tour Guides. 
Tour Guides who give tours inside of One World Trade Center and The 911 Memorial Museum are not required to be be Licensed by NYC to give those tours inside of each of those building only as is the case throughout NYC because they work for those institutions specifically. Only NYC Licensed Tour Guides can give professional tours outside of the One World Trade Center, outside of the 911 Memorial Museum, but inside of other Museums and Observatories in NYC that allow NYC Licensed Tour Guides to give professional tours with professionalism.🔴

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Ultimate Insiders Brooklyn Bridge Walking Tour
description:
This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to experience the Brooklyn Bridge by learning from the great-great-grandson of the original creators. Join Metro Tours' Kriss Roebling for one of the most unique walking tours in the world! You will be able to see and touch original pieces of the Brooklyn Bridge and learn family stories of how the Brooklyn Bridge came to be one of the most famous bridges in the world. Kriss will also bring family heirlooms on tour, showing notebooks and photos of his unique connection to the world-famous bridge. There is no other tour in New York City that will allow you to get this up-close-and-personal with Kriss and his family history.

We guarantee small groups, so you have a chance to interact with Kriss and ask questions. As a result, our tours do sell out. Join Metro Tours and Kriss on this amazing walking tour!

name: Lower Manhattan Secrets And History Walking Tour
description:
You can’t take a trip to New York City without touring Lower Manhattan. With a 400-year history, this vibrant neighborhood is bursting with landmarks, relics, and stories. Come discover the birthplace of New York as we know it and experience the city like a true local.

Highlights:

Journey through time and Downtown NYC the best way possible: on foot!

Explore the city with local certified guides who know every twist and turn on our world-famous streets

Benefit from a smaller sized group for a more intimate experience

Eat a real slice of New York style pizza for an authentic NYC experience

Enjoy free time to walk around the 9/11 Memorial

Our job isn’t over when the tour ends; we’ve got you covered while you’re in town with customized guides for shopping, eating out, and even the most Instagram-worthy locations to make your trip perfect

name: Tribeca Architecture And History Walking Tour
description:
Whether you are visiting Tribeca for the first time or you've lived here your entire life, the Tribeca Architecture and History Tour has something for you. With over 300 years of history, Tribeca combines historical landmarks and brave architectural feats into one fascinating neighborhood. Tribeca has a distinct personality all on its own, so we decided to honor it with its own tour.

Join us to learn more about the buildings and sites you may otherwise walk past without ever knowing their stories. You'll quickly come to see that Tribeca, a former farmland, is now one of the most fascinating neighborhoods in New York City.

name: Añejo Tribeca
shortDescription: Mexican, Tapas / Small Plates, Contemporary Mexican

name: Free Tour of Chinatown, Little Italy and SoHo (in Spanish!) (Available in Spanish)
description:
The tour will be through the Lower East Side to the expat neighborhoods: Chinatown and La Picola Italia.
In the 19th century, at the height of the Industrial Revolution, this area had a marginal population of diverse origins. Here, right here, ghettos were created for immigrants who came from distant lands to carve out a future. What they found was a city under construction, a state of chaos and no law or order. Everything was to be done, those people who could not even read and write, much less speak the language, made their way in New York. They chose to meet in communities of people from their own country who, just so happened to, live in the area of Manhattan with the cheapest rental housing. In groups, they were able to survive living poorly.
The neighborhoods of Chinatown and La Piccola Italia; the famous Five Points wrestling site; the restaurants that were the meeting place of the Chinese and Italian unions; the well-known Tenement, buildings where the emigrants lived; the first German Jewish Diamond District; the old factories turned into underworlds where Irish and African-Americans lived side by side in search of freedom, escaping from the slave camps of Virginia.
In the last part of the tour we will visit the SoHo neighborhood and end at the Basilica of Saint Patrick in the NoLiTa neighborhood.

What will we see during the tour?

  • Five Points wrestling site.
  • Famous restaurants, union meeting place .
  • the diamond district
  • Old factories where Irish and African Americans lived together.


...And much more!

Guide's note: this is a free tour with high demand and very limited places. The itinerary of this tour passes through historic and residential neighborhoods, with narrow streets and little space, so the groups are small. If you do not find a reservation, it is because the space is full and no more people are accepted for that departure. In case the reservation is made and you are not going to attend, we ask you to please make the cancellation so that someone else can attend in your place. Thank you so much.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Feast of San Gennaro
shortDescription: The Feast of San Gennaro, dubbed "The Feast of all Feasts," celebrates the life of San Gennaro of Naples who was the Bishop of Benevento, Italy. In 1926, a one-day block party continued year after year into something that has now and for decades become not only a New York icon but a world-known 11-day event that stretches throughout 11 blocks of Little Italy's neighborhood.

name: Village Halloween Parade
shortDescription: Hailed as the largest celebration of its kind, the Annual Village Halloween Parade draws over 60,000 costumed participants each year. The parade will stimulate all your senses as thrilling and eye-catching costumes, puppets, and floats are showcased to celebrate Halloween. Participate in the parade or join over two million spectators and watch in excitement as the costumes and floats slink by at the Annual Village Halloween Parade.

name: Macy’s Firework Spectacular
shortDescription: Costing nearly nine million dollars only on the fireworks, this 25-minute spectacle is synchronized to a rousing musical score and will feature a host of shells and effects in 30 colors and shapes. The Macy's 4th of July Fireworks have been a New York City tradition since 1976.
description: Costing nearly nine million dollars only on the fireworks, this 25-minute spectacle is synchronized to a rousing musical score and will feature a host of shells and effects in 30 colors and shapes. The Macy's 4th of July Fireworks have been a New York City tradition since 1976.

name: La Pizza & La Pasta - Eataly NYC Downtown
ONE Dine at One World Observatory
CUT By Wolfgang Puck at FS Downtown New York
Le Coucou
shortDescription: French Le Coucou is a famous refined French restaurant, proudly awarded 1 Michelin star, located at the center of New York’s Lower Manhattan Highly acclaimed chef Daniel Rose infuses French classic dishes with his sense of creativity and personality. A selection of “gourmandises” showcases such exemplary classics as pike quenelles or sauté sweetbreads can prove that the true essence of fine French dining can thrive in any time zone. Patrons here linger late into the night enjoying exceptional service, its picture-perfect elegant setting and a view of the bustling open kitchen. Opening hours Monday - Saturday: 11.30am – 2pm and 5pm –11pm Sunday: 11.30am – 2pm and 5pm –10pm Our advice Early reservations are highly recommended, especially during dinner time, because the restaurant always has a high probability to be fully booked. Recommended dishes: tout le lapin (includes three rabbit dishes: rabbit saddle, rabbit stew, and a rabbit gratin), quenelles de brochet (creamy pike fish cake), halibut in butter sauce,…
